column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Gris-Peg for about two months now with no improvement what so ever. It makes me nauseous and I have horrible dreams every night.

column2: Jalenmon, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My son is being treated with this Gris-peg for scalp ringworm.  He's been taking it now for 27 days and it has not cleared up his ring worm it's actually spread and gotten bigger in his scalp.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Took it for about 2 weeks, scalp cleared up perfectly within days so the doctor took me off of it. Infection came back even worse within a few weeks.  Started it up again.. Both time severe insomnia and loose stools for the first few days.  So frustrating to not be able to sleep but it does reduce the scalp symptoms fairly quickly.

column2: art, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got a sore throat my gums are sore,cramping stomach,sever chills,fever,sore muscles,flue like symptoms,stopped taking pills and conditions slowly improved,took pills for about a week seen doctor told me to stop taking pills one good thing is they think the ring worm is gone.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: WOW  flu like symptoms,headache ,ears ringing,runny nose ,coughing,sneezing,,,lack of sleep,just like having the flu,after  1 week,the ring worms resurfaced

column2: babydoll, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: after taking this med for about 3 days i develope a severe side effect of rash all over my body and face

column2: Gramma, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Some years ago Gris-Peg (oral) was prescribed for me for an agressive fingernail fungus. I had to stop taking it almost immediately. I think I had about every side effect that was noted, which is very unusual for me. My choice was to lose me or to lose the nail. There are other more effective products available today, so I'd certainly consider those - not Gris-Peg.

column2: tommyd, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first 30 days was good to go but did no get rid of it. So dermatoligist upped dossage . About the 3rd time of taking the uppd dosage i had a allergic reaction to it and got hives over 90% of my body and had to be rushed tothe emergency room. Havent taken it since and have beendealing with the infection for 5 years now.

column2: Eternity, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: So far my daughter has not had any side effects and the fungus has cleared up(x2weeks) and now we are continuing the medication for the color of her toes to come back.

column2: Bad Experience, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had to stop taking Gris PEG Oral after about 10 days.  10 minutes after taking the drug, my heart would start pounding.  About the 5th day, I had facial and vaginal swelling.  I had trouble sleeping.  My doctor told me to immediately stop taking the drug.  It was a terrible experience.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Medicine was prescribed for unknown fungal infection of the feet, after trying other medications without success.  After two days of use fungas was gone and skin had cleared.

column2: MOM, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
Lisa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I do not know if this medication works.  After taking it for two weeks, I broke out in a horrible rash.  Dr. said it was an allergic reaction to something I ate.  A few weeks later, I took another one of these pills and woke up a few hous later having trouble breathing.  I had all of the horrible side effects.  Needless to say, I will never recommend or take this medication again!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter was prescribed this medication for her scalp after trying several other medications. After being tested, I was informed by her primary doctor that she did not have tinea capitis and was sent to the dermatologist. She had a coulter taken there and was informed that the problem in her head was not ringworm or contagious. Although they wanted to treat it with medication used to treat ringworm. She was prescribed shampoo and an oral medication. (They didn't work!) As a result her hair began to fall out. After 2 years of trying several different medicine combinations and several specialists, we were given a prescription for Gris-peg oral. I am happy to say within 2 weeks we were able to see a difference. Her scalp had completely cleared and her hair began to grow in the areas in which it had fallen out. This lasted 9 months after treatment was complete. In exactly nine months the problem returned. Within a week her scalp looked as though she never had treatment. Nothing that we have tried has worked.

column2: ronald0749, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had a fungal infection under my right big toenail.  It took several months to clear up, but eventually healed completely with no apparent side effects.

column2: on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son was treated with it. We took him off after being on it for almost a year as the ringworm was not clearing. The cortizone cream alone actually worked best. He's been off for two months and still complains of headaches and stomache aches. I would not recommend it.
symtoms improved in 12 days of a 30 day script.
